page.title: 18Housing
page.content: New Tredegar was a mining village. It was very busy and many houses were built for miners and their families. This was over 100 years ago when the coal industry was at it's peak. New Tredegar is a valley and most of the houses were built near to the valley bottom, were it is flat. Now the coal has been exausted but 99% of the houses are still standing, some were demolished for road widening and improvements. The remaining houses had to be modernised to higher standards, to include bathrooms. These old houses were all terrace houses except some semi_detatched houses built for colliery officials.
